Reviews.Title: “Great location, but basic rooms and weak Wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: 2TravellingCanucks
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great location and basic accommodations, this is it. We found the wi-fi was a little weak, but we were in the room furthest from the street, so although the wi-fi was weak, we had a very quiet room and slept well. I think if you're the backpacker type not looking for lots of amenities (kitchen and pool), the price is good, the staff are friendly, and the place seemed pretty secure. Breakfast is pretty basic, but it will get you through to later in the day for a hearty local Mexican lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Peaceful and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Marco3354
Reviews.Content: Nice room with a fan and air condition system, we had an ammock just outside the door. Staff is very friendly and helpful everyday they gave us so many information on place to go and what to do. The location is great, just 2 minutes away from Avenida 5, easy to get from the coach station and on a nice stroll away from the party street. Very clean, very safe and easy breakfast to complete the description, we had a great stay over all, I would recommend it and for sure if I get back to Playa del Carmen I will come back here...

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, safe, caring, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MaryaE
Reviews.Content: I could not say enough about this small 2 Story hotel. Homey atmosphere and clean through out. Bonus free Skype and Internet usage . Everything close by and walking distance to 5 th Ave. The road is closed off to traffic , not sure if it is because of construction on the roads a few blocks down. The Price is right but make reservations direct on their website and will be a lot cheaper , I think $10 cheaper as they told me when I was leaving. This place I would go back to anytime. Happy to have found this quaint little place.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: KrystianoM
Reviews.Content: I stayed alone for a week there, except the fact that staff is great I do not reccomend it. Too expensive, breakfast poor. I forgot to mention great location, close to bus station, beach restaurants and main 5 Avenida. Last day I found scorpion under my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “good service, nice setting, comfortable clean rooms, loud neighbours”
Reviews.Author: glen g
Reviews.Content: The staff were great. The hotel itself is built around a nice garden and palapa, which makes it feel like a relaxing oasis off the bussling 5th av. The ambient music playing most of the time really added to this. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel offers free calls to most landlines wold wide which was a nice touch. Overall very enjoyable stay, only detractors were the noise, both at night from neighboring bars/restaurants and then in the morning as breakfast is set up.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and clean place to stay near Ave 5”
Reviews.Author: lj1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Barrio Latino for 4 days and used it as a base to explore. Great value, clean rooms and very friendly staff. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to our friends! This is in no way a negative comment but our only comment would be that you need to leave one ID (drivers license) during your entire stay and also your room key each time you leave. We are used to taking our key with us but it is really safe and there is someone always at the front desk. Also, be sure to bring toiletries (shampoo, conditioner and soap). We took the ADO bus from Cancun Airport ($10 pp each way). When you get off the bus exit to Ave 5 then turn left and walk down to 4th. The hotel is a block and a half away from the beach, Ave 5 shopping/dining, and two blocks from the Cozumel ferry. If you are going to Xelha, you can also take the ADO bus and it will drop you off right in front. The first bus leaves at 8:30 am and you get there around 9:15 am. There are two buses back to Playa - one at 5:40 and one at 5:55 pm. It is about $9 USD round trip with ADO. It is way cheaper than a taxi and my husband didn't really want the hassle of finding a collectivo. I would also recommend booking your Chichen Itza tour with the front desk. They offer a great rate plus the day trip is with a small group (less than 12).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and okay”
Reviews.Author: RachelleV
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the last leg of my vacation in the Cancun area. I was travelling solo for three nights and opted for Playa del Carmen instead of Cancun. Barrio Latino was just a block and a half off of 5th Avenue, 4 blocks to the ADO and 5 blocks to the Ferry. The room was very basic and clean. There is no tv and only a couple shelves to put your clothes. There was a small fridge in the room, but it made a lot of noise. The room I had was kind of noisey because of a bar that is a next door but I closed the shutters on the window and it wasn't too bad. The breakfast is a bun/croissant or cereal, juice and coffee/tea. The hotel is very secure and you hand in your key when you leave the hotel. They have free international calls with the help of the receptionist, which was really a nice perk. I booked on Expedia on late notice for $70/night and I think it was worth about $45/night (USD). Air conditioning and a safe was an extra $9USD. The pictures are accurate to what the room looks like. There is a good restaurant AJUI down the road that the waiters bring all the drinks to you on their heads. They have the best ceasar salad that is made right in front of you. Its not the cheapest meal, but has live music after 8 and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Budget_Traveller_JuD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days and liked the hotel and their pleasant staff. The room and bathroom is small but are very clean. The people at the front desk are very helpful in providing tips on where to eat, what to see and how to get to cenotes and places to snorkel. They also arranged for our trip to Chichen Itza for a decent price. The hotel is just a few blocks from the beach and shops. Our highlight of the trip was the owner's cute and friendly cocker spaniels - Mafy and Lola. They have a decent collection of novels left over by travelers which you can borrow to read during your stay. We found the people in general in Mexico to be very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: binder40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Wonderful location. Close to 5th Ave but far enough to avoid all noise and frenzied activity. Rooms clean and cleaning lady helpful-a new artistic arrangement made from our towels on our beds greeted us each day. Don't expect all the little goodies you find in more modern hotels. Breakfast basic and adequate but repetitious but located in a beautiful courtyard with lots of plants. We varied our breakfast by going to one of the many nearby restaurants. Personnel exceptionally courteous and helpful especially in providing information about transportation, etc for tours. Free phone calls to US, free use of their computer and lots of extra books to read if you wished.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: polkmnskg
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and pleasantly decorated. Toiletries are not provided so bring your own shower gel and shampoo. Location is great, you are close to the centre but far enough if you want to escape the crowds of playa. There is a beautiful garden where you can relax and you can borrow books and magazines from the reception.the atmosphere in general is very pleasant and the rooms spotless. The breakfast is basic. You get the option to have either a bowl of cereals or a piece of bread or croissant. If you missed reading the instructions and you ask for bread after finish your cereals, you are quite rudely reminded that it is either or.. Staff here can be a hit or miss..either very helpful or indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, quaint, clean, and safe!”
Reviews.Author: Lizardo23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Barrio Latino with my fiance for 2 nights: PROS: One minute walk to 5th Ave strip, friendly staff, safe and secure CONS: Toilet that didn't always flush GETTING THERE: You can save money by taking the ADO bus for $10 USD from Cancun Int'l Airport to 5th Avenue. From there, ask a worker for directions; it is a 10 minute walk to the hotel. I looked at a lot of other hotels that were twice the price, although located in the same district. Barrio Latino is in the heart of the tourist centre, and there are always places to go and places to eat. I would recommend El Fogon for their pastor!! ROOM: Comfortable, quaint with a hammock outside, and clean! Don't expect anything fancy, however, this hotel meets all your needs without having a TV or pool. I have to add that we did have tiny ants overtop the headboard in our room; this didn't bother us much, since having geckos and bugs aplenty is pretty standard in tropical countries (I stayed at a 5* resort that had some of these guys around too - - - so don't be surprised). Simply stow sweet candy in your luggage, and you'll be fine... I found that they got into a ziplock bag of Smarties! BREAKFAST: Standard continental fare - coffee or juice, with either cornflakes or pastry. The coffee is really good! If you are a healthy-eater, you can easily find something on 5th Ave. SERVICE/FOOD: Service was always prompt and courteous. I stayed in a Non-AC room, but this didn't matter much.... If your kids don't mind not having a TV or pool, I think you can easily bring children to this hotel... As for noise - our room did have background chatter from another establishment at night, however, we had earplugs, so this was inconsequential. You have to walk through the main office which is always manned, so it is safe and secure. There is no in-room safe or bottled water in the rooms. There is an abundance of stores around to find water to brush your teeth. All-in-all, well worth the money. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: 07Boston
Reviews.Content: I have been to Playa several times while traveling in Mexico. I don't always start at this hotel, but I always end up there. Let me start with this, if you expect an all inclusive experience that caters to your every need this is not your place. If you want a beautiful small hotel with good knowledgable staff and good value rooms than this is your place. The location is perfect: 4 blocks from the bus terminal and 2 blocks from the beach making a quite place for a good nights sleep. The rooms are clean with white sheets and towels. The bathrooms have a hairdryer, soap, and toilet paper as amenities. There is a small refridge in every room which is very useful. There is air con and a fan in every room. Also you have a small backing with a hammock and clothes line (very useful). There is wifi through out the hotel. My iPad had problems with signal in my room as it was in the far back, their solution was to give me my own router! There is also a computer to use in the main reception and a phone in which you can make free calls to about 40 counties. There is a small continetal brekkie included in the well landscaped garden. And the final touch is the two nice cocker spaniels that hang out. It is a very relaxing place to stay in a very hectic part of the yucatan.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, maybe the best deal of the season in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: mariondobrasil
Reviews.Content: I spent few nights but I wished I spent more. I booked using their booking engine and worked great. Also, I had to book a transfer from the airport and the answer was very fast. The rooms are just re painted and all the Hotel areas seem like new, together with location, breakfast and wifi I think it is a great deal to visit Playa del Carmen under 50 Usd. I would recommend it to my best friends! Rooms downstairs are very good to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Booked a return trip even before checking out!”
Reviews.Author: emrir
Reviews.Content: We finally found a gem of a hotel in Playa de Carmen and booked a night for our return trip even before checking out! This will be our official 'go to' spot in Playa de Carmen from now on and for good reason. The employees and owners were very friendly from the start of reservation inquiry all the way up to checking in 7 hours past our anticipated arrival time (11:30 pm). The property was very clean and just so enjoyable with a great outdoors garden/dining area, under palapa roof and on the interior of the hotel property. A great place to enjoy the free wi-fi and the tropical weather. The decorations in the patio lounge were lovely and were changed from the evening to the morning so it felt like a whole new place at each visit. We had a room with a king side bed, very comfortable with a variety of pillows for any weary head, our room was equipped with an a/c (we controlled it) and enough windows to enjoy the breeze as well a great ceiling fan if you don't want a/c. The patio had a hammock and a clothes line was availabe to hang your bathing suits and such. The staff was very courteous with directions, suggestions and all those crazy things you need to ask someone (again it didn't matter if it was 11p.m. or 8 a.m.). The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to both bus stations, Walmart to stock up on some supplies, the beach and the main drag. We also enjoyed a late late night dinner at the Italian restaurant across the street as well, a must try if you visit. I applaud Andrea, his wife and the staff they have choosen, for running a great little gem and we are looking forward to our return in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff were welcoming and helpful, they went out of their way to help us find our way around playa and gave us some great t”
Reviews.Author: Dogwalker77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, cozy and in a great location. The italian restaurant across the road was the best meal we've had in mexico yet. Great stay and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: voilatrip
Reviews.Content: I spent one week at the Barrio Latino. What a great surpirse! Excelent price, great room with all I needed, a beautiful breakfast area with a short but very good menu, excelent wifi and professional attention by the owner. Absolutely recommended. Booked via their web page and got a great rate : Would recommend it and be back tomorrow if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel near 5th Ave”
Reviews.Author: mchekaluk
Reviews.Content: Great value for location and the rooms you get. Very helpful in recommending restaurants. Can be noisy due to some late night bars nearby. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “paradise in playa”
Reviews.Author: fierce13
Reviews.Content: As with the prior reviews, if you are looking for an " all-american" hotel with all the bells and whistles, this is not going to be a comfortable fit. There is no TV, no partying in the rooms, and yes, in Mexico, water pressure is at a comfortable dribble comparatively. Having said this, what you will enjoy is a lovely hotel with your host/manager Marco his wonderful staff, and the dogs Lola and Mafy, in a bungalow style room. You will wake to birdsong, and you will stroll the block and a half to the beach to watch the sun rise and pull conch shells from the white sands. You are across the street from a restaurant, a cafe and a bar, all of which are good. You are in the local part of the city to the right of the front door, and a block from 5th Avenue on the left. Your location couldn't be better. It is a clean, quiet little hotel that is a real gem for the seasoned traveler. I heard that it was noisy prior to my arrival, but we live on a busy street in San Francisco, and we thought it was just as quiet and relaxing as it could be. If you want to be in the middle of everything, while just a block off the beaten path, with the sweetest staff, and a clean quiet room, this is the place. OH YEAH, they also have free books to read, free internet and free calls to the US if you need them. We Will be back, just as soon as we figure out how to pay for the next trip. Hello to you all at Bario Latino

Reviews.Title: “Clean place with great ambience, helpful staff, decent price, and good location.”
Reviews.Author: TLRJohnny
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay here. We booked the first two nights before we went online just in case we didn't like it, but we signed up for the rest of our trip after our first day. This, in fact, turns out to be the best way to do it as they charge a significantly lower rate in person than they can when you book online. Probably the best advice unless you're at the very peak of high season (and are therefore worried about finding accommodations) is to just reserve the first night online ahead of time and then add the rest after that - we saved about 30% doing it this way (~$70 online and ~$55 in person). It's perfectly located if you ask me - 1 minute from 5th Avenue and the beach beyond but far enough so that you aren't kept awake too much by the noise in those places. Anyway, the place was spotlessly cleaned every day. The rooms were not huge, but the bed was - king sized and comfy. The AC was much appreciated after the intensity of the tropical heat. Lockable safe in the room. Gorgeous inner courtyard - tropical trees and a grass-thatched palapa in the middle. Free WiFi was also a big bonus. On the slightly down side, there was sometimes a bit of a smell from the drains that wasn't awesome but which also wasn't hard to quickly forget about, and the continental breakfast was not really worth attending - the coffee was garbage and the buns were uninspiring. After the first two days, we just got our breakfast elsewhere. One of the best parts was the super reliable, always approachable, very knowledgeable front desk guy, Marco. He helped us so much over our stay, from understanding how to catch buses and collectivo taxis, to finding places to eat, and sorting out other issues. His English is very good, too, so I felt that If we had a problem, we had someone who would be able, available, and happy to help us out. That's worth a lot to us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjc_1971
Reviews.Content: After reviewing Lonely Planet's recommendation, we decided to stay at Barrio Latino. The hotel is at a quiet place, close to the main street and to the beach. Nice atmosphere, cute and clean rooms, free wifi, wonderful staff. Miguel was just a delight, very friendly and told us about great local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable-affortable-clean and close by from actions place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JackDaniel07
Reviews.Content: Visiting this hotel you will find nicely decorated rooms , wich are comfortable and cleaned every day. Small but convenient fridge in room, ceiling fan with A/C available (if you pay for it ???) The price of the room include a light ... well let's say very light continental breakfast including : one coffee (second one free wow !!!) , one small fruit juice and one serving of pastery (no toast only croissant or top sugary bonds) and a 1.5 tablespoon of jam (strawberry imitation like ... ) '' or '' a boll of cereal . Be advise dont be to ungry an take a second pastery or another serving ... or you will have to pay for it ... they have someone on duty to check on you for that. Let's say that a choice of different type of fruits : banana, pineapple, mangos, papayas (wich grow and sold so very cheap in Mexico ... ) would have been very nice to accompany this light meal in the nice center surrounding garden they have. -- Attention : while you eat your light breakfast, do not give Mafalda or Lola (the hotel owner's dogs) a tiny peace of pastery because if cought you will be strongly advise ...

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to stay 3 nights but had to move out because of 'misunderstanding'”
Reviews.Author: Isotopo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice enough, but we had a bad experience which is worth telling. We (2 couples) arrived at Playa on a thursday late in the afternoon, with no reservations, and started looking for a hotel. We found room at Barrio Latino and decided to stay there for 3 nights. We repeatedly told the clerk we wanted to stay for 3 nights and there seemed to be no problem. It's worth mentioning we speak spanish fluently so there was no possible language problem with the mexican clerk. The next morning another clerk told us we had to move out because all rooms were already booked. So we had to find another hotel, pretty much ruinning our plans for the day. Later in the afternoon we went to complain to the owner. He was quite nice, apologized for the 'misunderstanding' and told us we could come for breakfast and use the phone during our stay in Playa. Even so, we can't help thinking there was foul play involved and that the clerk deliberately didn't tell us on thursday night that there wasn't going to be room the next 2 nights (if we new this we would have looked elsewhere) so that we would stay for that night in 2 rooms that otherwise would probably have remained unoccupied (considering the late hour). You be the judge...

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, great wifi, all together the best price in Playa del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: happypolediver
Reviews.Content: I was part of a diving group from Poland. We spent several nights at the Barrio Latino , and when the group left I spent more nights because I loved the place! Great wifi service and free international calls including my Country. Very close to the beach and very calm and safe at night. Staff is very friendly and the owner knows his work : I knew several repeating clients , an important number of people around 50s, younger couples, and a funny mix of straight and gay clients from Europe, Usa, Canada. The hotel is very well designed and the rooms with terrace and hammock open to a relaxing green area. I totally support the policies for the local environment and workers seem to follow them, too. I had a look in the area : this is the best bet for me. Hotel Luna Sol is overrated , is only one block back but the block is dark, and maybe since the owners are selling had less success at the moment (even so it was nice, but I would defenetly recommend Barrio Latino over Luna Sol, Casa Tukan, Nina) : none of them include the courtesy international calls (and local too), the garden, the wifi, the parking, the breakfast all in one. About Playa del Carmen, I think it is a great place to visit and use it like a safe basis (and funny too) , while we spent most of the days diving the caves and open sea. Bravo Barrio Latino!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel with quite yet central location”
Reviews.Author: Cream_and_sugar_40
Reviews.Content: During our trip trough Yucatan peninsula we spent one night at Playa del Carmen. Destination as such was not really to our taste but Barrio Latino sure was. Room was big enough and hammock outside the room was a nice addition. Bathroom was big and clean, something you start to appreciate when traveling for a longer period of time and seeing different hotels. Hotel has personal touch with garden, decorations and paintings on the walls, free phone calls,and small breakfast included to room rate. Main tourist attractions were nearby yet hotel itself was really quiet. Overall, we were really happy to stay here and would definately stay again should we visit PDC again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hot spot”
Reviews.Author: a__harris90
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! staff were friendly, free wireless internet and two blocks from the beach! it is also situated one block from the main shopping street! room was very clean with good maid service! i would definantly stay here again! and the best part is its cheap! the only part i did not like about this hotel was the free breakfast you were only allowed 1 glass of juice and either a crossiont or a bowl of cereal, i guess you cant ask for much when its free

Reviews.Title: “The Best Yet”
Reviews.Author: clandrum_10
Reviews.Content: This is a small quiet hotel with very clean rooms and an excellent staff. 2 cute little dogs Lola and Mafy made my stay very memorable!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to stating ther in my future visits to Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “No Room at the Inn - had Reservation”
Reviews.Author: blkimmel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel over a month in advance. We ended up arriving early and stopped by to see if they had room. They said they did not, but they were expecting us the next day. When we went back on the day they had us reserved they said they were overbooked and would move us to another hotel. They moved us to a a very poor hotel that we would have never reserved for the price we paid for Barrio. Poor Poor Poor management

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING QUAKITY FOR YOUR MONEY.”
Reviews.Author: deanweanie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here at the Barrio Latino in Playa Del Carmen,,and enjoyed it so much.It is a very personal and friendly little Hotel.The owners care very much,and are sociable. The place is always clean,always smells clean. They let you used the Internet for free,,,,,,,free calls back home to Canada or U.S,or Europe . Free breakfast in the very cute Pallapa CourtYard....They have two little cute dogs that walk around.... I am TRULY a Fan of this place,I've been there 2 times now,and plan to go more often..I prefer it over my Time Share.. They treated me so well, and with the Cleanliness you must try it..... Dean Adams,Ormstown, Quebec, Canada....... :)

Reviews.Title: “just perfect !!!”
Reviews.Author: fifinou973
Reviews.Content: we have just spent 8 days in this hotel and I can only recommand it ! the staff is very helpfull and nice. Rooms are cute, nice bed, spotless, cleaned every days ! there's a continental breakfast included in the price, which is very nice. It's close to the beach and to the 5 th avenue. Lots of nice restaurants around ! There's a free wi fi connexion which workes perfectly. If you are looking for a small hotel with good service, good value, very well located, the Barrio Latino is the place to go ! We hope to go back there soon !!

Reviews.Title: “Clear, Safe and Friendly place in Playa.”
Reviews.Author: MSK-RUS
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in this charming hotel after the cruise. The price was really good. Location is perfect just 3 min from the beach. Bus station is 3 blocks away. Easy to find and easy to get there. Staff is very helpfull and friendly. Free internet. Good access to Wallmart and local cafes. I will definitely recommend this hotel for young couples and backpackers. There is one thing which is not good you should wait for a hot water in bath tub for 5 min.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, blocks from the main drag, clean, safe with style, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LocalWay
Reviews.Content: Barrio Latino was a great option for what we were looking for: a safe, comfy place to be in Playa Del Carmen without the excessive price tag and somehow away from the party block. It seems to be well run by a detail-oriented owner. We definitely recommend and would stay again. PROS: *Safe, the reception desk guy would open the locked gate every time we would arrive at night *Friendly and Knowledgeable staff, always ready to help *Comfy Beds *Clean Rooms *Walking distance to Bus Station *Blocks from the main 5th ave. CONS: *No TV *It's not close to the nicest part of 5th Ave. *Bar behind the hotel can get noisy sometimes

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, thoughtful and kind - and care to the Environment too!”
Reviews.Author: studioaerie
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to Playa after more than 20 years and so much has changed. Now with so many choices for a place to stay I was thrilled to have found Barrio Latino Playa del Carmen - they were the perfect choice! The Mexican feeling of the hotel was so welcoming, simple but with character, the beautiful garden (as well as the cutest cocker spaniels who stay for some hours in the hotel!) all made me feel instantly a part of Playa. The room was sweet and subtly colorful - I felt like I was in the real Mexico - and with all the amenities too! I was most appreciative to learn that they take care to the environment and don't waste unnecessary energy (they kindly turned off the ac when I forgot once before I left for the day). There was just the right amount of morning breakfast choices too and the free WiFi was a great perk! The staff was friendly and helpful (especially with the simple things I had forgotten after all these years) I definitely wanted their opinion on local restaurants because there were so many choices and not nearly enough time. See you next year everyone at Barrio Latino!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Archimedesrules
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from the Lonely Planet listing because the hotel we had originally booked (Hacienda Maria Bonita) was very noisy. The hotel us located two blocs away from Avenida 5, which means there is no bar / nighclub / restaurant / street noise in the immediate proximity. The buidling is in fairly good condition and is run by friendly gay staff. Rooms are spacious enough with very nice en-suite bathroom. Hot water takes some time to come, though. The beach is 5 mn away. There is a shower available if you need to check out and want to spend your last hours on the beach. Overall a very nice place, great value for the money, with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice to stay in Barrio Latino and we would like to come back again”
Reviews.Author: Helicid
Reviews.Content: Hotel have perfect location one block from noise on main ave and still close to beach. Services were excelent, everything was clean, fast, air condition workes well and rooms have large bed. Inside hotel is place were you can is under palm trees or in hammock which is in front of every room. Room service were excelent and they made animals from linen and towels almost every day. That is something more that you dont have in every hotel. Recepcion service was good as well and helpfull in the email and on the place also. Small minus is for small breakfast but you can buy more for small amount on place or you can go to local bakery. We were in Mexico for leisure and also for Maya ruins so we have to leave early many times - hotel is close to bus station so it is good for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: EstGui
Reviews.Content: We always select our hotel following Tripadvisor comments. It is the first time that I can say that I am disappointed by an hotel recommended by Tripadvisor. Except the location which is central in Playa Del Carmen and the color of the room, the bathroom was not clean and had a musty smell. The shower was full of sediment. The breakfast was really poor: choice between bread and cereals. All the rest were extra charges. They turn off the A/C when you left your room and when you came back, the room is so hot that it is diifficult to stay there. The price of the room is really not cheap for the service. The scuba diving is really great in Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel is really closed and the reef is one of the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, basic rooms but a friendly and quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roxy2584
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a cheap place to stay for my sister's Destination wedding so based on some reviews here we chose Barrio Latino. We booked it on Expedia.com w/our airfare for a great price. Only 'surprise' (I don't think this was listed on the expedia site when we booked) when we arrived was that to use the hotel's a/c and safe it was an extra $10/per day- this wasn't a huge deal but slightly unexpected. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and accomodating- plus the hotel cocker spaniels, Lola and Mafalda were very friendly. Rooms were cleaned every day and although the rooms were basic it did have a fridge which was nice. The location of this hotel is a few blocks north of the busy 5th avenue so it was quiet at night and the restaurants near this hotel seemed to be less 'touristy' and more authentic and cheaper. Only bummer about the room was the beds, pretty stiff springs but still slept pretty good each night. The continental breakfast in the morning was basic (cereal/crossiants) but really good (the guava juice and coffee were excellent!). The courtyard/garden area was also a very nice space. Overall for the price we were happy with our hotel choice. I don't think we will be back to Playa as it was definately more expensive than Puerto Vallarta. Also, although I knew a fair amount of Spanish, I was surprised at how little English everyone in Playa spoke compared to Puerto Vallarta. Its hard to give Playa a very fair review when I really fell in love with Puerto Vallarta last spring . . .

Reviews.Title: “safe little simple hotel with beautiful garden”
Reviews.Author: MissPlaise
Reviews.Content: After hearing horror stories about hotels in Playa from a woman I met today, I thought I'd write a review for this great little hotel in Playa. As a solo woman traveller, I tend to look for hotels that make me feel secure. Barrio Latino met my requirement 100%. A little safe is in the room to put your things. I also had my laptop, and felt that I could leave it in my room without problems, which I did. The room I had was very cute, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom was nice. There is a little fridge in the room to store some beer. :) Someone came in every day to clean and made the extra effort with fancy toilet paper and towel art. Internet connexion in the room was good. There is a hammoc in front of every room, good for reading and relaxing. The breakfast was ok, very simple (juice, coffee or tea, a bowl of cereal or a bread), but still nice to have that option. I usually brought a piece of fruit to complement the breakfast. The palapa in the garden where breakfast is served is beautiful. Free international phone calls in the reception is nice service. The location is excellent, far enough from the party noise on Quinta, but still very close walk to the beach. Overall, I recommend staying here !

Reviews.Title: “charming & cozy”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustt
Reviews.Content: I think there may be some variation to individual experience at Barrio Latino depending on the specific room. I read somewhere the rooms here were on the dark side, but that wasn't my case. Perhaps one should look at the different rooms before deciding, if possible. I had a room on the second level above the office that was somewhat smaller and lacked the individual terrace area or the hammock that other rooms had. But because of more natural light and privacy it provided, I began to prefer it immediately. It rained on my first night, and I was awakened to a leaky roof. Although it was fixed the next day (I was told), I was offered another room downstairs that looked bigger and newer. But by then, my little room seemed like the most perfect one for me, so I opted to stay. I liked having a view of the street instead of facing the courtyard. I could sit in the hammock chair for hours, alternating between surfing the web (free wifi), reading a book, and watching people on the street below, all in relative seclusion. The beds had nice new mattresses with good linen. I also appreciated the extremely quiet ceiling fan. The hotel & the room were generally quiet. The bathroom could be a potential problem area for some. The tiles in the shower were getting old & chipped, and some could seem mildewy. The sink pipe leaked a bit, too. The other bathroom I saw was shining new. Those who will pay locally should keep in mind that the price is given in USD and could fluctuate in peso with the exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilR_007
Reviews.Content: The Barrio Latino is a lovely hotel; especially when compared with some of the other soulless, dirty chain hotels found in Playa Del Carmen. The rooms are nicely decorated; but are basic so maybe not suitable for people looking for a plush 5* hotel; but if you want Mexican charm then you won't be disappointed. The beds are comfortable, the showers are warm, the AC and and fan worked perfectly - also (and importantly in my opinion) the rooms and bathrooms were very clean. The hotel isn't on the main drag; which is a bit of a plus in my opinion as another hotel I stayed in (Hotel Labnah - avoid like the plague!!) was very noisy until late at night because of neighbouring clubs... Barrio Latino is very quite and peaceful. The rooms look out onto a small courtyard, which is nicely maintained, but as mentioned the rooms don't get all that much natural light - but to be honest, you're in Mexico - get out of you room and go and see something!! :) The breakfast could be better; the food is nice but a little sparse - you can buy extra items at a small charge; but I think more should be provided as standard. All in all I'd easily recommend this hotel - on my 2nd visit to Playa Del Carmen (we were on a round-trip) we stayed at hotel Labnah which was absolutely awful; so we checked out and tried to get back into the Barrio Latino which was unfortunately full... the guys were helpful and recommended us to try the Hotel Casa de las Flores, which was really, really nice (although a little walk from town)... I'd recommend this hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, quiet and clean but also central.”
Reviews.Author: Rokococo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay close to but not right in the middle of the busy avenue 5 and we were not disappointed. The hotel is small (16 rooms) and clean, quiet and feels secure. We had air con, fridge and our own room safe – all three were used! It also, as a bonus provides a continental style breakfast where you have a choice of croissant or cereal and a hot drink, it might not sound like much but it provides a good start to the day and is included in the price of the room. There is free wi-fi also available (which is more than you can say of some of the 5 star all inclusive resorts) and each room comes with its own hammock which is great for chilling out. The staff are friendly although I do wish I spoke more Spanish! The location of the hotel is great, is downtown, easy walking distance from the ferry and from the bus station as well as avenue 5, it is though quiet at night, which, for me, was such a bonus. The only down side was that the plumbing wasn’t that great as we had a leaky shower but apart from that for the price this hotel is, you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, reasonable deal, would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bestmeg
Reviews.Content: I have just recently stayed here for just the one night on my way up to Cancun and its a beautiful hotel and very easy to find. I paid $68 for a double room (3 days before christmas) with air conditioning and the bed was huuuge! shower was nice and it comes with a hammock outside. Would definately stay here again. And its very peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Made a reservation, arrived at the hotel and they did not have a room”
Reviews.Author: moskid
Reviews.Content: It is a hugh disappointment when you arrive at your hotel with reservation confirmation in hand and no room, especially at 7 PM on a Saturday night. The only good thing I can say is that they called Hotel LunaSol for us and they had a great room for less money. I reserved on line with my credit card (which the man at the desk said they would not charge) so it wasn't like I didn't intend to check in. I would definately recommend re-confirming your reservation before arrival. We visit Playa about once a year so not sure if I will try Barrio Latino or go back to LunaSol next time. Guess it depends on what we find on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “wish I stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: valenceroberts
Reviews.Content: Barrio Latino in Palya del Carmen was a lot more than we expected. A very cute hotel with lots of charm and character. The rooms were very comfortable, very clean and of a good size. Location was great - centrally located, walking distance to everything while still being quiet. We weren't sure what to expect or do in Playa del Carmen, but the owner of the Hotel - Andreas was really helpful in telling about the sights and how to get there as well as was was happening at the time. The last and best surprise was the service - throughout the stay they were always very helpful and at the end I left my watch that was handed down to me. I never thought I waould see it again but sure enough the staff had put it aside and helped send it back to Australia. Thanks Hotel Barrio Latino - I recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super stay”
Reviews.Author: KasparZ
Reviews.Content: Great place to rest before and after beach. Super friendly staff, even the owner helps you out with all the questions that you have. I will be back in this hotel in very near future.

Reviews.Title: “A Business accomodation in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Maltaintravel
Reviews.Content: I spent one week between October and November at the Hotel Barrio Latino. My booking experience was fast and good. I sent a first mail to enquiry about parking and wifi facilities, the answer was in hours and suggested me to enter the web page and book, like I did, a Superior room and mention the proposal of my travel in the comments line, in order to get a room with good wifi signal, and a desk with table for my pc. I got room number 12 which I enjoied, while my collegues staied upstairs and we had meetings in the big thatched area , an oasis of calm very well kept and cleaned every day after the breakfast schedule. Parking was very difficult to find downown , so that the hotel in front of the Barrio Latino was charging 5 dlls a night. Barrio latino had very good rates and the parking for free, so that was a great deal to me, adding the use of the safe in the room, a very well working air conditioner, and the hammock outside my room which I could enjoy a lot when not working. Because of a very low season in a difficult year, most of the hotels downtown I could visit, or I could walk close, were empty, but the Barrio Latino was almost full every night of the week I spent there. People came and left, and I could notice they were from countres like Us, Canada, Australia, Mexico, adding several europeans from Italy, France and me with my group from Malta. It was nice to have short talks with them. While I was there, the signal was getting even better, because of a new router and several point to point antenna they were trying to install. Overall, I think Barrio Latino is the best choice for people like us who go for Business in the Mayan Riviera to visit clients of the tourism market, because of the location, the great service, and the unbeatable prices. This breeze of relaxed fun we could share with the other guests made everybody happy and maybe I will go back with the family! Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Playa”
Reviews.Author: MarcoSFO
Reviews.Content: I liked everything: the colors of the room, the perfect garden, the hammock. Very quiet but just 2 blocks from the busy 5th ave and 3 minutes walk to the beach. Cozy athmosphere, functional details, eco-friendly and above all: ultra-clean. Confy new beds, air con, refrigerator, safety box in the room. Super-professional staff, free calls to land lines worldwide, free internet (one pc available and wi-fi), breakfast included. Little price. I'll move in here for the rest of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Close to bus station, food & beaches. Clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: dtx75220
Reviews.Content: Small hotel that try's hard. Decent food on the street, close to everything clean rooms, quiet and safe. Great value good cold air condition, friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Caribbean Room is perfect for a romantic getaway...”
Reviews.Author: loknbree
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about Barrio Latino! The staff and owner are amazingly helpful with recommendations for so many things to do and good restaurants in the area. We stayed in the Caribbean room with the palapa style roof which was a perfect introduction to our holiday. It is slightly smaller than other rooms but has much more character and is more private as it is separated from the main building. You can get free wifi access from your balcony sitting in a hammock which is great and the complimentary breakfast is sufficient to start a day of lazing around doing nothing much or walking the 200metres to the beach. Booked for 2 nights and ended up staying 2 more... Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, but Palapa/Caribbean room is very poor”
Reviews.Author: KiowaVT
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice atmosphere and a good location. Yes, they monitor the front, but thus there is a sense of security. And they do have wireless access, a big part of why we chose the hotel. However, they list a nice Palapa Caribbean room and on the internet choosing the pictures made it look the equal, the price was only $2 less after taxes, so we figured it would be similar. Not so! WAY back, out of wireless range, tiny, shower head did not work so shower was like faucet, dark, windowless. When they took us back to our room we walked past all these great rooms and got excited. Then saw our cell. My girlfriend was ill, needed the bathroom, and by the time we knew there was no wireless and this room should sell at about half the normal room price, we had dirtied things up and had to run to meet friends for dinner. So, a lousy part of a nice hotel. Breakfast was, as others mention, limited. Juice, one bread or cereal, and coffee/tea. Nice central area to eat, though, and look at all those other larger, nicer rooms. Argh!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, we stayed 3 times and will come back”
Reviews.Author: MountainStrawberry
Reviews.Content: Rooms are simple and comfortable. I like the colors and overall decor. The hammock outside the room is neat. The owners and staff are friendly. The whole place feels very laid back and relaxing, their dogs are some of the most relaxed creatures I have ever met. The court yard and breakfast area have lots of greenery and nice outdoor art. Wireless Internet is also available. It was a nice shady place to sit with my Dell Mini and plan for the day ahead. The hotel is few minutes from the beach, outside the touristy area, but close enough to places to eat and get bottled water and things like that. It also feels very safe. We stayed at Barrio Latino in January 2008, and again in May 2009 before leaving for a road trip around the Yucatan peninsula, and then again on the way back. It is definitively the place will stay the next time we are in the area. We don't want to have anything to do with Cancun, and this place is only an hour from the airport, so we just skip Cancun all together and drive directly to Playa. We got in late the last time and just walked across the street to the restaurant called Tucan (I think), and had the best mole chicken and some pretty good fish.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff! Absolutely recommendable.”
Reviews.Author: choci
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and I was in touch with them by email and telephone. Easy handling. Unfortunately I was not able to make my trip to Mexico. But I am sure if I go one time to Mexico, I will choose again this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Quaint Hotel With a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: xwumpx
Reviews.Content: I think Hotel Barrio Latino is probably one of the best values in Playa del Carmen. The hotel itself is very charming and full of personality. I had read reviews about people in love with the shady courtyard and the individual hammocks outside of each room. While I didn't end up having time for my hammock, it was lovely to know it was there waiting for me. The room was cute and quiet and did the trick. The toilet in my room was a little tricky, but definitely not something that would prevent me from staying at this hotel again. The hand-painted walls and accents are nice touches, and it really fits the quaint feeling of Playa del Carmen. There are also two cocker spaniels who permanently live at the hotel. I'm a dog person, so I absolutely adored having them running around. If I had to complain about something, it would be that the staff was a bit more knowledgeable. The two young people who generally ran the front desk didn't have many recommendations. A small part of it may have been a language barrier since I speak very little Spanish, but it would have been nice if they could have been a little more helpful on that front. I believe I did talk to the owner and his wife at breakfast on a few occasions, and they actually had very good recommendations and always seemed excited and willing to help. I think I would have moved into the hotel if the two of them could be around all of the time. The breakfast wasn't the most exciting breakfast I've ever had, but for the price of the hotel I definitely didn't mind venturing out a few mornings for a bigger, more substantial breakfast. I would definitely recommend this hotel especially over the big, showy resorts. It's about two blocks away from the beach, so it's close enough to the action to be convenient but far enough away to be quiet and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubbishystuff
Reviews.Content: Clean, cozy rooms. Good location, close to the action in Playa but enough off the main strip to be quiet. Price includes continental breakfast. Many rooms have hammock out front. They even allowed us to check the mattress of our room before accepting.

Reviews.Title: “Clean friendly and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: vsmileNyc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went on a 5 day vacation to Playa del Carmen to spend time together scuba diving, relaxing and enjoying the sun and the local culture. When we arrived our room was ready and the people greeting us couldnt have been nicer. They provided us with great suggestions of where to eat and what to do. The room was clean, fresh and set up with heart shaped towels. Every morning we enjoyed a complimentary breakfast in the garden and every evening we came home to clean air conditioned rooms. The location was perfect. It was walking distance to everything and a stones through to the beach but quite at night. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone vacationing in playa del carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Quiet, Value”
Reviews.Author: NevNpat
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, 2 blocks off of 5th. Management were extremely accomodating. We originaly booked the Carribean Room with the palapa roof and found this room to be too small for two people and fairly dark. Luckily they had space available and for the best price difference, we had to pay $10US per night for one of the Standard Rooms. This change made a big difference in our overall enjoyment of the hotel and Playa. The Carribean Room only has small windows on one side, and the bathroom was quite small too. The standard rooms were considerably larger, have windows on both sides of the room which allows a cross breeze into the room, with a larger bed and bathroom. As well as a larger a/c unit (which may or may not work, we didn't care, because we prefer a ceiling fan, which worked well). Overall, the hotel is clean, and so was our room. Security seemed top notch, with the front gate always closed. And locked after 11pm. The in room safe boxes are large enough for most traveler valuables however it did not fit our laptop with 16" screen. Some additional towels and a bathmat would have been welcome additions but were not crucial. The free parking was great and secure, however, there is only room for about 5 vehicles and its a first come first serve, but I think you can park on the street for free and staff can watch it too. Parking was full on our last night but not on any of the others. We asked for a quiet room and were given the second from the end, But almost any of the rooms except the three nearest the street are most relaxing, with only the very distant sound of this vibrant city sounding in the night. Yes there is a bit of a pong from the drains in the washrooms, and they do request you do not put any paper down the loo, but this is normal in a lot of countries, and is actually better for the environment, we should all be putting our paper in the bio waste. Neither are that bad. There is a laundry right across the street so you can pack light and get your clothes cleaned at the service while at the beach. It rained hard one evening so we went to the Casa Tucan across the street for dinner and it was one of our best value meals in Playa. To sum it up, clean, quiet, nicely decorated, acceptable breakfast, ncie dogs, pleasant staff, secure and great value. We thank everyone at the Hotel Barrio Latino for making our vacation most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of peace in Playa”
Reviews.Author: SLPTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked a private room in a hostel for the last 2 nights of our trip to stay in Playa. It was a disaster - noisy with 4 bars within 4 meters, no window, shared dirty bath. We checked out after one sleepless night and started looking for something better. We found Barrio Latino and checked in. One night at 650 pesos, king size bed, available immediately, free breakfast, private bath with good shower, and a ceiling fan AND a/c (a real plus since my husband hates a/c). The staff was friendly, the dogs were adorable, and the hammock on the balcony was perfect. I had to give my drivers license over, pay in advance, leave the key everytime we left, and let the staff check the room before checkout, which are not unreasonable policies but were a bit surprising. The room was spotless, the bed was comfortable, the noise was reasonable, and the breakfast was more than adequate. I highly recommend this hotel, especially with the great location just close enough to the beach and 5th avenue but near enough to the "real" town to get the local flavor and eat at local places. I was starting to hate Playa, but this hotel turned my attitude around.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: cmstella
Reviews.Content: We walked into Hotel Barrio as exhausted, dirty travelers needing a one-night stay in the city. The staff was exceptionally nice and for the price... (43 US dollars) we could not complain. The hotel had all the ear-markings of being remodeled, and presented with fairly nice shabby chic decor. We viewed our room before agreeing to stay and found it to be average at best, but satisfactory for one night. However, staying in this room (#22) proved to test all patience. Our toilet barely flushed (three try minimum) and it came with a sign posted on the wall to dispose all toilet paper into a waste basket instead. When we ran the sink faucet to brush our teeth, we were greeted with the smell of sewage. The musty, rotting smell of the bathroom was so strong that opening the door in the morning took stamina and nose plugging! All we really wanted was a one-night stay in a quiet hotel where we could wash away all our dirt from traveling on our last night in Mexico. This was definitely not the place for this! We also did not have enough towels, and could not use our AC due to the rattling noise it made when turned on. We had to close most windows to keep out the street noise from surrounding hotels as well as noisy guests on the first floor, and our shower continuously dripped and leaked even when turned off. The few pros to this hotel were two helpful, pleasant desk clerks that spoke English, a location only a few blocks off Avendia 5, and our king bed was surprisingly soft and comfortable, and not a typical hard Mexican hotel bed. Also, part of our disappointment stems from disliking Playa del Carmen in general. I have no idea why people chose to visit such a cheap, crowded, dirty tourist trap at all when there are much more beautiful places to see along the Riviera Maya! I suppose there are much worse places to stay in Playa, and for the price Hotel Barrio is probably one of the better options- but although I loved the Riveria Maya, I have no plans to waste time in this city or stay at this hotel again in my lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Understanding management”
Reviews.Author: Jocky603
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in Playa del Carmen as we really liked the website, location and price. Unfortunately due to medical reasons we had to cancel our trip. The management were very understanding and kindly allowed us to cancel. We were due to stay just after Christmas and do hope that they manage to re-book the room. Many thanks to Andrea for being so understanding.

HotelInfo.Name: Barrio Latino Hotel Playa del Carmen
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 4 entre Av 15 & Av 10 | Colonia Centro Beach Area, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
